title: Firefox forcing daily restarts to "update" then making me create a new profile.
content: At least once a day since Version 145 dropped Firefox has told me I need to restart to update. When I do, it shows a pop up telling my I am opening an older version of Firefox and need to create a new profile to avoid corrupting my data. Daily, sometimes twice a day I have to go in and switch profiles back to the profile that has all of my book marks. Every computer in our office has this issue now. One of them deleted a profile without prompting, and it is not even in the appdata folder with "deleteme" in front of it. It is just gone. The last update had tabs crash daily. Is there any hope of stopping the second broken update in a row from wasting my time fixing it every day?
creator: kenohki1500

title: Firefox is about privacy, so why are *any* AI options enabled by default?
content:
On a brand new profile for Firefox without configuration of any kind I get an AI chatbot in the sidebar and AI tabs suggestions.

Why?

Is Mozilla looking to destroy decades of good will?

Anything like this should be something you have to opt-in to see, not try and opt-out of.

If privacy is a true concern then any of that stuff should be an extension, and not something on by default.

I really don't understand why Mozilla is doing this.

title: firefox update will not allow me to login to yahoo accounts
content:
Have recently updated Firefox and now I am not able to login to my Yahoo mail. I know it is not an issue with security on my PC as I can login no problem with Chrome and have tried with AV and Firewall turned off. Tried emptying cache etc but nothing worked. Eventually backed up bookmarks and passwords and deleted Firefox completely, including all files and profiles, reinstalled and still the same problem. Am running win7 and YES, I know this is not supported now but evertything was fine until new update.

After trying to log in it says 'something went wrong, try from a different device'. It works fine on my laptop with Firefox and fine on PC with Chrome so can only come to the conclusion it is Firefox update on PC. This is causing major problems now as can only access mail through Chrome and site links sent cannot be opened as passwords are saved in Firefox. Also have other work that needs to be urgently completed where I need to be able to use sites and mail on same browser.

Any ideas on what could be wrong would be appreciated as things are getting desperate.

title: Firefox.exe suspicious file
content:
Today as I got to work (Windows 11 machine), I had a suspicious Firefox.exe file on my Desktop, it was not a shortcut, but exe file. I did a little investigation and research, and I noticed some difference from Program Files exe file and Firefox.exe on my Desktop:

C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe

Size: 695424 bytes SHA-256 hash: EEB242895F8ED48B43EAAA9ECA06C6DDE54425F8AE0E16200D2D46F839B9A540 File version: 145.0.0.327 Copyright: ©Firefox and Mozilla Developers Date modified: 16.11.2025 12:35 Original filename: firefox.exe Digital Signature: Mozilla Corporation

and Firefox.exe that appeared on Desktop

C:\Users\User\Desktop\Firefox.exe

Size: 389248 bytes SHA-256 hash: E8DA5735FE1B5E92BA3636B8D17B5BEC0EA521DB6A8B5A52177FF3E8B2F60710 File version: 145.0.0.327 Copyright: Licence: MPL 2 Date modified: 16.11.2025 12:35 Original filename: desktop-launcher.exe Digital Signature: Mozilla Corporation

I scanned both files in VirusTotal, and they both seems clean and legit

I uploaded both files to:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kALgQbfhIpHqs1pN6dmTdF71nm10LlD-/view?usp=sharing

Can somebody assure me that both files are OK, and can somebody explain to me why Firefox.exe appeared on my Desktop, and why is there difference between two files in size, Copyright info, and original filename ?
creator: bojan.admin

title: I am all ears
content: The best meal I have ever had was a warm plate of doro wot with soft injera. The spicy aroma, the rich red sauce, and the tender chicken made the meal unforgettable. I loved how the injera soaked up all the flavors, making every bite taste deep and comforting. It was so good because it reminded me of home and brought a feeling of warmth and happiness. I would enjoy having this meal often, but maybe not every day — it’s the kind of special dish that tastes even better when you’ve waited for it.

title: Fallos constantes en ubuntu 22.04
content:
La cuestion es la siguiente, tengo firefox que viene por defecto en ubuntu 22.04, y desde hace un par de años he notado que de repente firefox esta abierto pero cuando intentas escribir, este no funciona, tienes que reiniciar nuevamente firefox porque en este ya no puedes escribir.

Me jode mucho , porque es mi navegador preferido, y siempre abro varias pestañas donde me logue a distintos servicios como gmail, mis webs y demas, y tengo que reiniciar el navegador para que funcione, llevando por consiguiente volver a loguearme en el mismo.

Pasa algunos dias, no sucede siempre. Cuando esto ocurre busco si el proceso se ha quedado colgado o consumiento mas memoria o cpu y aparece normal.

Por ultimo sale la ventanita que dice "firefox no responde" forzar detención o esperar.

Como comento sucede hace un par de años aproximadamente solo que en los ultimos dias esta molestando más.

Creo que en su momento escribi algo directamente a un email de mozilla comentando al respecto, tampoco hubo respuesta de nada , ni siquiera si se habia recibido el email


El pc tiene todas las actualizaciones de firefox y del sistema.

Saludos y muchas gracias
creator: adrianeso

title: Design Suggestion : Make a Clean Restart as Functional as a Restart After a Crash
content:
On those somewhat rare (but not all that infrequent) occasions when Firefox locks up and hard crashes and all 6 or 7 of the windows that are open go up in a puff of virtual smoke, (each with their uniquely organized selections of tabs) - upon a restart of FF all of the windows return reliably.

But when a clean shutdown of the program is initiated only the "top" window or two returns, and as far as I've seen there is a limited number to the "Recently Closed Windows" available to recover from the History menu.

Clearly the state of the applications windows is preservable - why not recover all of them, similar to the "on startup pick up where I left off" setting for pages and tabs.

(Incidentally Adobes applications exhibit similar behavior - the system actually works better and can recover the entire "workspace settings" but only if the power is abruptly cut off, (and no tedious waiting for updates to complete as a bonus!))
creator: ZZZZaxxon

title: Be nice
content: Follow through. Sometimes, our volunteers would ask you for more information or to test out certain scenarios. The sooner you can do this, the sooner they would know how to fix it.

title: Be nice
content:
Be nice. Our volunteers are Mozilla users just like you, who take the time out of their day to help.

Be descriptive. Saying “playing video on YouTube is always choppy” will help us understand the issue better than saying “something is wrong” or “the app is bro ken”.

Follow through. Sometimes, our volunteers would ask you for more information or to test out certain scenarios. The sooner you can do this, the sooner they would know how to fix it.
creator: umaramahee

title: Como remover o botão do Firefox para dispositivos móveis da minha tela inicial?
content: Quero minha home limpa, discreta, sem botões e informações inúteis para mim. Isso apareceu na versão 145.0, está fixada a imagem do botão. Já experimentei e não uso o Firefox para dispositivos móveis por questões de design e usabilidade que acho muito ruins, por isso prefiro usar o Samsung Internet ou o Brave. Não quero o navegador me sugerindo a mesma coisa toda vez, igual ao Edge.

title: Firefox bookmarks and history still isn't functioning
content: I wrote yesterday but my post doesn't appear today. Today I got the message about bookmarks and history not functioning and eventually found something in Firefox that said it was probably due to "some security software." I have now gone into Windows settings and my security updates are done, but I have no idea what I'm supposed to do now. This is an extremely annoying and disruptive issue. I see that several other people are experiencing it, so it's interesting that the note next to their posts state that no one else is having the same problem. Can someone please help us all to get our bookmarks and history back?
creator: nmbourne

title: Firefox on Mac will not allow user to complete X's new passcode requirement
content:
I've been using Firefox on Mac and PC for many years, and been on Twitter/X for 12 years. Never had a problem before this.

X is now requiring users to enter and verify a 4-digit passcode to be able to use the DM feature. Firefox on Mac won't let me do this. Every time it produces an error message:

"Unable to load encryption module. Please refresh the page and try again."

But when I do it in Safari, or Explorer, or Chrome, it lets me do so.

The problem is, most of my data and resources are on my Macbook, and I have not been able to find a workaround. I've cleared my cache, made sure I'm on the latest version of Firefox, restarted it several times - same thing.

I need to get this fixed. Please help.
creator: jonsutz1

title: Firefox desktop
content:
I have a rather strange problem and I'm not sure this is the right topic. I generally use my computer on and off all day and I never lock it until the evening when I turn it off. I went out for several hours today and when I came back there was a new version of Firefox installed. When I opened Firefox I realized it was a new version because it would not let me logon until I had completed a profile. My old version never did this. In addition all of my saved passwords had disappeared as well as my bookmarks. I'm using a Dell laptop running Win 11, about 2 years old. I don't understand how this could happen. There was no one here while I was out. I looked to see if there was a saved profile but only the one in use showed up. The current version appears to be 145.0.1. One thing that might have something to do with it. I might have been asked yesterday if I wanted to synch firefox on my computers but I'm not sure how I answered this (I'm almost 90 and my memory is a bit imperfect).

I do have Firefox on a second desktop which is running Win 10. Is it possible to use that profile. That computer has not been turned on since this happebd and is currently asleep. Any help or suggestions will really be appreciated!
creator: wls4
